decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with aggressive spirit creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and flash creatures. The deck focuses on leveraging the synergy between spirit creatures, such as Empyrean Eagle and Supreme Phantom, to swarm the opponent and deal damage quickly. Collected Company is used to find key creatures and maintain pressure, while Brazen Borrower provides additional disruption and a tempo advantage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent access to the needed lands.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up creatures with powerful auras, making them stronger and harder to deal with. By using a combination of auras like Gryff's Boon, Sentinel's Eyes, and Ethereal Armor, along with creatures like Favored Hoplite and Aphemia, the Cacophony, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. The inclusion of cards like Karametra's Blessing and Alseid of Life's Bounty also helps to protect key creatures from removal, ensuring they can continue to attack freely.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo between Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by emptying the library and ensuring Thassa's Oracle's ability resolves first. It includes control elements like counterspells and tempo plays while also having the ability to generate mana through Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to cast multiple spells in a turn. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition efficiently and quickly.

The main focus of this Dimir Inverter deck is to manipulate the top cards of the library in order to win the game by combining Thassa's Oracle with Inverter of Truth. The deck includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Drown in the Loch to control the game while also including card draw and filtering options like Opt and Dig Through Time. The win condition revolves around having either Thassa's Oracle or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries on the battlefield alongside a stacked graveyard to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Inverter of Truth and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries combo to win the game by decking out the opponent. The deck includes various control elements such as counterspells, removal, and hand disruption to protect the combo pieces. It also includes card draw and filtering to help find the necessary pieces. The win condition is to use Jace to draw cards when the library is empty, with Inverter of Truth essentially turning the deck upside down to make this possible. The deck aims to control the game until it can assemble the combo for a win.

This deck aims to efficiently dig through its library with cards like Opt and Dig Through Time to find the combo pieces, Thassa's Oracle and Inverter of Truth. By controlling the game with removal spells and disruption like Thoughtseize, Censor, and Fatal Push, the deck sets up the win condition of either self-milling with Inverter of Truth or using Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot. The key to this deck is to carefully manage resources and timing to successfully execute the combo and secure a victory.

The main focus of this Dimir Inverter deck is to effectively use cards like Thassa's Oracle, Jace, Wielder of Mysteries, and Inverter of Truth to manipulate the library and win the game through a combo finish. The deck also includes a mix of control and disruption spells like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Tyrant's Scorn to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies. By efficiently controlling the game and setting up the combo win condition, the deck aims to secure victories through a combination of library manipulation and strategic play.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Champion of Dusk, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Gifted Aetherborn, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck also includes some removal spells like Grasp of Darkness and Murderous Rider to deal with opposing threats. Additionally, Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord can provide additional support and synergy with the vampire creatures in the deck. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on efficiently playing aggressive spirit creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent and establish air dominance. Cards like Brazen Borrower and Empyrean Eagle provide strong threats, while cards like Spell Queller and Selfless Spirit offer protection and disruption. The deck aims to establish a board presence quickly and maintain it with support from cards like Supreme Phantom and Nebelgast Herald. Using a mix of evasion, tempo, and creature synergy, the spirit aggro deck seeks to close out games swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost Spirit creatures and buffing them with anthem effects like Empyrean Eagle and Supreme Phantom. By utilizing evasive abilities and disruptive spells like Spell Queller, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a swarm of flying creatures. Cards like Curious Obsession provide card advantage while cards like Brazen Borrower and Selfless Spirit offer versatile utility. The mana base includes a mix of lands that ensure consistent access to the necessary colors for casting spells efficiently.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with small, efficient creatures and powerful anthem effects to boost their power. The key strategy is to deploy multiple early threats, buffed by cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells like Stasis Snare. The deck aims to establish and maintain board presence through a combination of aggressive creatures and resilient threats, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a relentless assault of creatures backed by powerful enchantments.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by milling out the opponent's deck. It includes various card selection, disruption, and removal spells to control the game until the combo can be executed. Jace, Wielder of Mysteries serves as an alternative win condition if the combo pieces are unable to be assembled. The deck aims to efficiently manipulate the library and utilize powerful blue-black spells to outpace and outwit the opponent in a strategic battle of wits and resources.

The main focus of this Dimir Inverter deck is to utilize cards like Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by either decking oneself or manipulating the library effectively. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board and protect the combo pieces. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo while also having the tools to disrupt the opponent's strategy, making it a versatile and powerful choice for Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on quickly getting artifacts onto the battlefield and turning them into threats with Ensoul Artifact and Skilled Animator. By combining the aggressive nature of artifacts with powerful cards like Shrapnel Blast and Stonecoil Serpent, it aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and efficient creatures. The inclusion of counterspells like Stubborn Denial and versatile creatures like Emry, Lurker of the Loch adds an element of control to the deck, providing protection and utility. Overall, the goal is to swiftly close out games with a mix of damage and disruption.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures like Bloodsoaked Champion, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Scrapheap Scrounger to pressure the opponent early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push to control the board. Rankle, Master of Pranks adds versatility and can help maintain card advantage. The deck's land base includes Castle Locthwain and Mutavault to provide additional utility and flexibility. Overall, this deck aims to be fast, aggressive, and resilient in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disrupt their game plan with hand disruption and removal spells. The deck focuses on a low curve and efficient creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Scrapheap Scrounger to apply pressure early on. Thoughtseize and Fatal Push help to control the opponent's strategy, while cards like Rankle, Master of Pranks provide additional disruption and ways to push through damage. The deck aims to be efficient and relentless in its attacks, while maintaining some versatility in its removal options.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy utilizing spirits to overwhelm opponents. The cards work together to provide early pressure with evasion abilities and disruptive counterspells to protect key creatures. The inclusion of card draw and pump effects ensures the deck can maintain momentum and out-value opponents. With a mana base that supports consistent casting of spells, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory quickly.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost spirit creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with flying and anthem effects. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Supreme Phantom, the deck can easily flood the board with strong creatures. Cards like Selfless Spirit and Spell Queller provide protection and disruption against the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Settle the Wreckage acts as a board wipe against aggressive opponents. Overall, the deck aims to maintain early pressure and tempo to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this Dimir Inverter deck is to use the combo of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by emptying the library and then winning through the "win the game" trigger of Thassa's Oracle or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The deck includes disruptive elements like Despise, Thoughtseize, and Drown in the Loch to control the opponent's game plan while digging through the deck with cards like Dig Through Time and Opt. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent performance.

The key strategy of this deck is to control and disrupt your opponent's game plan using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while setting up the combo win condition of either putting Thassa's Oracle or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries on the battlefield with zero cards in your library thanks to Inverter of Truth's ability. This allows you to win the game instantly by either drawing a card with an empty library or by milling yourself out. The deck also includes card draw and filtering effects to help assemble the combo pieces efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo of cards involving Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by either decking out the opponent or creating a game state in which you have no cards in your library to win the game. The deck includes a variety of control and card draw spells to help set up the combo and protect it from disruption. The goal is to assemble the combo as quickly and efficiently as possible while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on using the cards Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to manipulate the library and win the game through a combo. It includes cards like Jace, Wielder of Mysteries and Dig Through Time to dig through the library quickly, along with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the game. The key strategy is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and protect them from opponent's disruption, ultimately winning the game by either decking out or using Thassa's Oracle to win on the spot.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo of Inverter of Truth and Thassa's Oracle to win the game by either decking out your opponent or creating a situation where they can't stop you from winning with Oracle's ability. The deck includes a lot of card draw, disruption, and removal spells to control the game until you can set up your win condition. Jace, Wielder of Mysteries is also included as an alternate win condition. The mana base is built to support the combo while keeping flexibility with different types of lands.

This Artifact Aggro deck focuses on quickly turning artifacts into powerful creatures with Ensoul Artifact and Skilled Animator, while also utilizing cards like Ghostfire Blade and Shadowspear to provide additional buffs and utility. Shrapnel Blast and Karn, Scion of Urza add reach and card advantage, allowing the deck to maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of counterspells like Stubborn Denial and protection spells like Dive Down help to protect key creatures and ensure the deck can maintain its aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble Lotus Field and utilize various cards to generate a large amount of mana, enabling casting of powerful spells like Dig Through Time and Fae of Wishes. This combo-heavy archetype focuses on setting up an explosive turn where the player can search for key cards, draw through their deck, and potentially win the game in a single turn. With the right sequencing and card selection, this deck can overwhelm opponents with its mana advantage and efficient resource management.

The main focus of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively attack the opponent with a variety of resilient and powerful creatures such as Bloodsoaked Champion, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Spawn of Mayhem. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push and Murderous Rider to clear the way for your creatures to deal damage. Castle Locthwain and Mutavault provide additional utility and card advantage, while Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth ensures consistent mana production.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures like Bloodsoaked Champion, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Spawn of Mayhem to chip away at the opponent's life total. Using efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Murderous Rider, along with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Rankle, Master of Pranks, the deck aims to control the game while still maintaining pressure. The inclusion of cards like Scrapheap Scrounger and Gutterbones provide resilience and the ability to maintain a board presence even through removal spells. The deck's manabase is optimized for consistency and includes utility lands like Castle Locthwain and Mutavault to give additional advantages in longer games.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game through a combination of powerful spells and diverse threats, all centered around Niv-Mizzet Reborn. By utilizing a range of removal, counterspells, and versatile creatures, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also maintaining card advantage with Niv-Mizzet's ability. The deck's mana base is designed to support its various color requirements, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and making optimal use of Niv-Mizzet's powerful effect.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with low-cost, aggressive creatures and efficient burn spells. By using cards like Abbot of Keral Keep, Bonecrusher Giant, and Goblin Rabblemaster, along with support from Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Additional damage can be dealt with Lightning Strike and Wild Slash, while Embercleave provides a powerful finisher. The inclusion of Mutavault and Ramunap Ruins adds versatility and additional reach to the deck's aggressive strategy.

The central idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Torbran, Thane of Red Fell, along with efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Goblin Chainwhirler, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. With a focus on dealing damage directly to the opponent, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The mana base is streamlined to support the low curve of the aggressive creatures and burn spells.
